title: Voting for CSM19 Begins Today in EVE Online
description: The day has arrived and voting has begun for the Council of Stellar Management 19. In the CSM19 schedule of events we are now in the voting period. 17 September – 1 October: Candidate Submissions and application processing begins 4 October: Candidate Announcement 4-14 October: CSM 19 Campaign Period 17-24 October: CSM 19 Voting Period […]
author: Wilhelm Arcturus
excerpt: The day has arrived and voting has begun for the Council of Stellar Management 19. In the CSM19 schedule of events we are now in the voting period. 17 September – 1 October: Candidate Submissions a…
text: The day has arrived and voting has begun for the Council of Stellar Management 19. Council of Stellar Management 19 In the CSM19 schedule of events we are now in the voting period. 17 September – 1 October: Candidate Submissions and application processing begins 4 October: Candidate Announcement 4-14 October: CSM 19 Campaign Period 17-24 October: CSM 19 Voting Period There is no date announced for the results yet, save for a statement that it will come after the voting period ends. I’m also still unsure what candidates were expected to do on the 15th and 16th… except maybe get banned from the election?  Is there time set aside for that now? Voting is already active as of this post and runs until 11:00 UTC on Thursday, October 24th.  That is downtime next Thursday, the usual cut-off time for most EVE Online events. For those of us in the US, that means that we need to get our votes in by Wednesday the 23rd or risk sleeping through the end of the election. In order to vote you must have an Omega (which is to say, subscribed) account that is older than 60 days.  No poors, no Alphas. That being said, you don’t need to spend the $20 cash or the 2.5 billion ISK to get 30 days of play time.  CCP offers a special Weekend Fleet Pack that gets you three days of Omega time and 50 PLEX for $3.75, so you have a pretty modestly priced way to be able to pay your way to the ballot box.  Are you that committed to the election? Then there is the candidate list, below in alphabetical order. There are 47 candidates on the ballot, down two from the initial announcement.  Alcoholic Satan was removed by CCP as noted previously and Yondu Quill withdrew, which was announced in his campaign forum thread. Candidate Alliance Corp Aerodinamica Attiva None Reckless and Uncontrolable Feeding Alcoholic Satan* (banned) Pandemic Horde A Blessed Bean Ankh Lai Goonswarm Federation Strategically Bad Aqustin Agustus Brave Collective Spoopy Newbies Ariel Rin The Initiative. Tactically Challenged AtheistOfFail None Totality Squad Aurous Victoirespere Space Madness. DutchGunner Wicked Angels. Circle of Abyss Frippyy Goonswarm Federation KarmaFleet Frozen Fallout Federation Front Line Federation Front Line Report Gideon Zendikar D-sync. No Vacancies Mike Azariah* None The Scope MILINT ARC Trooper None Pator Tech School NeoShocker Scary Wormhole People The Dark Space Initiative Phantomite** Watch This Blue Canary Prospektor Schipplock EDENCOM DEFENSIVE INITIATIVE EDENCOM Section 7 Redus Taw Pandemic Horde Farmers Union Iced Coffee Rots Mijnwerker Out of the Blue. Into the Ether Seddow Deepwater Hooligans Outback Steakhouse of Pancakes SeriesPro UNITED SOUTH Don’t Be a Menace to South Central SKALE Organa TURBOFEED OR GLORY Holey Roamin’ Empire steven mardis Sugar. Wormhole Effects Storm Delay* Pandemic Horde Horde Vanguard. Styxx D.A.R.K. Dark Shado Switch 4 Divine Damnation Heretic Army The Oz* None Pecunia Infinita Viciate Minmatar Fleet Alliance Rattini Tribe Yondu Quill withdrew Brave Collective Brave Newbies Inc. youngpuke2 Sedition. Jerkasaurus Wrecks Inc. Zintage Enaka Goonswarm Federation Echelon Research The voting page and all the CCP information is linked below.  As I run across ballots for various groups I will put them in the comments just for reference. Now is the time to vote.  You only get seven days.  Most people get their votes in on the first day or the last day of the election.  Don’t be the person who forgot. html:
The day has arrived and voting has begun for the Council of Stellar Management 19.

Council of Stellar Management 19

In the CSM19 schedule of events we are now in the voting period.

  • 17 September – 1 October: Candidate Submissions and application processing begins
  • 4 October: Candidate Announcement
  • 4-14 October: CSM 19 Campaign Period
  • 17-24 October: CSM 19 Voting Period

There is no date announced for the results yet, save for a statement that it will come after the voting period ends.

I’m also still unsure what candidates were expected to do on the 15th and 16th… except maybe get banned from the election?  Is there time set aside for that now?

Voting is already active as of this post and runs until 11:00 UTC on Thursday, October 24th.  That is downtime next Thursday, the usual cut-off time for most EVE Online events.

For those of us in the US, that means that we need to get our votes in by Wednesday the 23rd or risk sleeping through the end of the election.

In order to vote you must have an Omega (which is to say, subscribed) account that is older than 60 days.  No poors, no Alphas.

That being said, you don’t need to spend the $20 cash or the 2.5 billion ISK to get 30 days of play time.  CCP offers a special Weekend Fleet Pack that gets you three days of Omega time and 50 PLEX for $3.75, so you have a pretty modestly priced way to be able to pay your way to the ballot box.  Are you that committed to the election?

Then there is the candidate list, below in alphabetical order.

There are 47 candidates on the ballot, down two from the initial announcement.  Alcoholic Satan was removed by CCP as noted previously and Yondu Quill withdrew, which was announced in his campaign forum thread.

Candidate Alliance Corp
Aerodinamica Attiva None Reckless and Uncontrolable Feeding
Alcoholic Satan* (banned)

The voting page and all the CCP information is linked below.  As I run across ballots for various groups I will put them in the comments just for reference.

Now is the time to vote.  You only get seven days.  Most people get their votes in on the first day or the last day of the election.  Don’t be the person who forgot.
